justification: “Because we established above that errors indirectly reflect intentions, we speculated that the FRN may serve as a proxy for intention.”
“We hypothesized that the P3 may serve as a proxy for foresight, since, as we argued above, there is a link between foresight and feeling surprised.”

“The P3… is triggered by processing an unexpected, noticeable, attention-demanding, or otherwise relevant stimulus… therefore, we hypothesized that the P3 may serve as a proxy for foresight, since… there is a link between foresight and feeling surprised.”
“The FRN is thought to be akin to an ‘error detection’ signal, as it is elicited after receiving external negative feedback, indicating that [the] action that was just performed was incorrect.”
